page.title: 01Westbury Village.
page.content: {Westbury,}is a sprawling village, possibly of{Saxon}origin. There is a mixture of privately_owned and council property and farms.{Facilities}include Post Office/general stores, Police, garage/farm services, Public House, Primary School and playgroup, Doctor's, Church_cemetery. The village is visited fortnightly by the County Library van, and monthly by Shropshire Health Authority mobile Child Welfare Unit. An infrequent bus service is available every day except Sunday. A Village Hall, ball-court, village field are available for{leisure}and Club activities. {Dairy farming}is predominant. Local farmers are noted for their success with Ayrshire and Guernsey cattle. They also produce potatoes, soft fruit, root crops for animal feeds. Sheep, pigs and ducks are less common.
